_header: There been four things that make a man a fool
_description: Four things that make a man a fool — one stanza rhyme royal

CamTCC600.First Lines:
Þere beoþe foure thinges þat makeþ man a
                    foolhonnour first putteþe him in oultrageAnd aldernexst solytarye
                    and soolÞe secound is vnweldy crooked aage…
CamTCC600.Last Lines:
…And mighty wyne in many dyuers wyseDistempren folk wheche
                    been holden wyse
CamTCC600.Editions:
MacCracken,  Henry Noble,
                        ed.  
             John Lydgate: The Minor Poems, Vol. II: Secular Poems.
EETS
         o.s. 192 (1934); repr. 1961: 2.708.

BLAdd29729.First Lines:
ther be fowr thyngs that makyth man a foollhonnour fyrst puttethe
                    hym in owhtrage…
BLAdd29729.Last Lines:
…and myghty wyne in many dyvers wysedistempern folke whiche
                    bene holden wyse
BLAdd29729.Note:
Before heading, relating to several short entries that follow,
                    ‘Here beginneth serten thinges of Iohn lydgat copied out of þe boke
                    of Iohn sherley / by Iohn stowe’ (f. 132), apparently added by scribe
                    (John Stow).
BLAdd29729.Attributed Title: a seyng of dan Iohn lydgat (f. 132)
